channel.title: Speeding up compiz fusion for my crappy graphics card
channel.description:
Hey all, I decided to install Ubuntu and KDE using the kubuntu-desktop package. Everything works fine, even got nVidia drivers for my crappy old GeForce 2 Mx working and got compiz fusion working as well. Works a lot smoother than beryl.
I also got a new LCD monitor that runs natively in 1680 x 1050 resolution which is quite high for my graphics card. It can barely render normal non 3d things without lag. Compiz fusion works great but I need to speed it up. I know a few techniques such as toning down the rendered frames per second and disabling certain plugins. For beryl, there used to be a beryl manager, but I don't know how to tinker with these settings on compiz fusion. I really don't want to be messing with 20 000 line configuration files.
1) Does anyone have any more tips on speeding up compiz (other than getting a better graphics card)... 2) How do I change compiz settings without touching configuration files?

item.title: Speeding up compiz fusion for my crappy graphics card
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

Yes, I know about both newegg and tigerdirect. I used to get parts for my friends from both of them. However, I’ve decided not to invest in my old Athlon socket A rig anymore. I’ll build a new socket AM2 system with all the latest parts and use my current one as a file backup server and so on.[br][size=1]Posted on: October 04, 2007, 05:13:29 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:148808”]The one for $51 is a low-end 6800, that is a lot of bang for you buck, I would go for that one.

I am not sure if newegg will ship to canada though, you will have to check. If not tigerdirect.com is a canadian company I also order from all the time, and they are the same or cheaper than newegg. :)[/quote]
But you’re right, the $51 one is a lot of bang for my buck, so I think I’ll get that one anyway. Thanks a lot for finding that!

Read full topic

The one for $51 is a low-end 6800, that is a lot of bang for you buck, I would go for that one.

I am not sure if newegg will ship to canada though, you will have to check. If not tigerdirect.com is a canadian company I also order from all the time, and they are the same or cheaper than newegg.

item.title: Speeding up compiz fusion for my crappy graphics card
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:148808”]http://www.newegg.com/Product/ProductList.aspx?Submit=ENE&N=2010380048+1305520548+1069609639+4026&name=%2450+-+%2475

9 cards, $50-$75 that will work for you. That link should work, tell me if it doesn’t. Out of those I would recommend:

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814141057 if you could afford the $70
or
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814141060 for $51[/quote]
Wow! Thanks a lot! I looked there. Thing is, I can’t decide between the nVidia 5xxxx and 6xxxx AGP 8x series.
